task.title: Select Nodes by Search
task.shortdesc: Select nodes using the Like bar to perform a text search.

context.p: Similar to selecting nodes by Class type, the Like function is used to filter nodes according to specific attributes. In this case, the attributes are text-based. The Like function searches the database of node names for textual matches. Matching nodes are then selected to execute a Command.The Like bar offers full Regex power. For example, searching "19\d\d" will return matches for numbers in the range 1900-1999.ONLY the node names are searched. The Like function does NOT perform searches on other features like Set/Class types or Snippet text.

step.cmd: Type a search term into the Like bar.
Click a Set or Class type to choose a category of nodes to perform the search on.
step.info: Text searches can be performed on any of the Set or Class types. To search all nodes for matches, click All under Sets.

step.cmd: Click on the desired Verb to choose an action.
Click the GO! button to execute the command on the matching nodes.
